org.ametiste.metrics.experimental.activator.conditions.scopes.request

Class RequestScopeDetector

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ametiste.metrics.experimental.activator.conditions.scopes.request.RequestScopeDetector

  • public final class RequestScopeDetector
extends java.lang.Object

    Helper functions to check Spring Web MVC webrequest-scope context.

    Since:
    0.2.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RequestScopeDetector()

      Extracts a parameter with the given name from the request bound to current context.

      Check that the operation is called out of the request-scope.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RequestScopeDetector

        public RequestScopeDetector()

    • Method Detail

      • isNotRequestScoped

        public static boolean isNotRequestScoped()

        Check that the operation is called out of the request-scope.

        Returns:
        false if called within the request-scope, true if not.

      • isRequestScoped

        public static boolean isRequestScoped()

        Check that the operation is called within the request-scope.

        Returns:
        true if called within the request-scope, false if not.

      • isTrueForRequest

        public static boolean isTrueForRequest(java.lang.String parameterName)

        Check that the request parameter containes variable with the given name. And the variable has value of 'true'.

        Returns:
        true if called within the request-scope, false if not.

      • extractRequestParameter

        public static java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> extractRequestParameter(java.lang.String parameterName)

        Extracts a parameter with the given name from the request bound to current context.

        WARNING

        This operation is unsafe cos Spring Framework does not provide any interface to check scope, please do exceptions handeling.

        Parameters:
        parameterName - name of parameter to be extracted
        Returns:
        optional value of parameter with the given name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - in case where operation called out of request-scope
